did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Minutes of the Virginia Board for Hearing Aid Specialists,
did.origination: Virginia. Board for Hearing Aid Specialists.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: This Board for Hearing Aid Specialists was established in 1970. The purpose of this Board is to license those who are qualified, either by a temporary permit or full licensure, to test and fit individuals who need the assistance of a hearing aid. The Department of Professional and Occupational Regulation provides administrative support to the board. In 2012, the Board was merged with the Board of Opticians to create the Board for Hearing Aid Specialists and Opticians.

odd.p: These records are part of the Virginia Dept. of Professional and Occupational Regulation record group (RG 17)

accessrestrict.p: Meeting attachments must be reviewed for personal information and redacted prior to being served.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Virginia Board for Hearing Aid Specialists, Minutes, [cite specific date and accession used]. State government records collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Va. 23219.

scopecontent.p: These records consist of minutes, agendas, and related attachments documenting the activities of the Board of Hearing Aid Specialists. May also include informal fact finding conference documents and conflict of interest statements.
